column4: I'm really battling with this: unable to get the system to work with any video drivers other than vesa drivers.  I have a GeForce 6600GT.  I have tried apt-get install, xorg reconfigure, manually editing the sync modes, restricted drivers, and Envy.  When I start, I either get a blue screen or "No Signal" until I restore the xorg config with the vesa driver enabled..
don't configure manually
sudo nvidia-xconfig
maybe you should try #nvidia?
did you try either sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx or nvidia-glx-new?
- I tried the nvidia-glx-new, yeah
the easiest way is to use envy or restricted manager
- Ive tried both of those
I think if you tried to install drivers manually, then you should continue doing this
are you long time with ubuntu?
the best way I think is to reinstall, then in fresh install just do sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-new
I would prefer doing like this
afterwards sudo nvidia-xconfig
hope it will work
- yes, I did a clean install now.  All I've done so far is install nvidia-glx-new and nvidia-xconfig
maybe first you downloaded drivers from nvidia?
after installing drivers you have to restart system
did you restart the computer?
- afraid so.. I've also tried some other stuff like editing the SYNC frequencies manually
pastebin your /etc/X11/xorg.conf into www.pastebin.ca and show the link
maybe enable composite?
